001package edu.pdx.cs410J.airlineweb;
002
003import edu.pdx.cs410J.ParserException;
004import edu.pdx.cs410J.web.HttpRequestHelper;
005import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
006
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.io.StringWriter;
009import java.util.Map;
010
011import static org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat;
012import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.equalTo;
013import static org.mockito.ArgumentMatchers.eq;
014import static org.mockito.Mockito.*;
015
016/**
017 * A unit test for the REST client that demonstrates using mocks and
018 * dependency injection
019 */
020public class AirlineRestClientTest {
021
022  @Test
023  void getAllDictionaryEntriesPerformsHttpGetWithNoParameters() throws ParserException, IOException {
024    Map<String, String> dictionary = Map.of("One", "1", "Two", "2");
025
026    HttpRequestHelper http = mock(HttpRequestHelper.class);
027    when(http.get(eq(Map.of()))).thenReturn(dictionaryAsText(dictionary));
028    
029    AirlineRestClient client = new AirlineRestClient(http);
030
031    assertThat(client.getAllDictionaryEntries(), equalTo(dictionary));
032  }
033
034  private HttpRequestHelper.Response dictionaryAsText(Map<String, String> dictionary) {
035    StringWriter writer = new StringWriter();
036    new TextDumper(writer).dump(dictionary);
037
038    return new HttpRequestHelper.Response(writer.toString());
039  }
040}
